Description: Rim sherd of East Greek Black Polychrome pottery dinos; dull black paint inside; traces of band in added white; frieze of tongues with incised outline on top of rim, alternating black, added white, and added red; second similar frieze on shoulder.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Ure Museum of Greek Archaeology, Reading. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Probably from the same vase as 26.2.81. Accession number in pencil reads 26.2.80 but accession number in ink reads 26.2.89.
Bibliographic references: CVA Reading I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain, Fasc. 12, University of Reading (p. 38, pl. 23, no. 16)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GK.39)
